Omar To Fundraise For Hamas-Linked Muslim Organization; Combating Anti-Semitism2019-02-19T00:00:00Z2020-10-05T21:11:40ZLexisNexisAndrew McCabe Claims Trump Believed Putin Over U.S. Intelligence; Jussie Smollett Staged Attack After Racist Letter Didn't Get Bigger Reaction; Trump Urges Venezuelan Military Officials To Back Juan Guaido; Trump: America Will Never Be A Socialist Country; U.K. Parliament Issues Report Calling Facebook 'Digital Gangsters'; De Blasio and Ocasio-Cortez Feud Over Failed Amazon Deal; Rep. Omar To Fundraise For Hamas-Linked Muslim Organization; Combating Anti-SemitismLanhamFULL TEXT

LOU DOBBS, FOX BUSINESS NETWORK ANCHOR: Good evening, everybody. This aversion is President Trump and his administration on full display this weekend as former FBI Acting Director Andrew McCabe actually confessed that he, Deputy Attorney General Rod Rosenstein and a host of corrupt FBI and Department of Justice actors sought to unseat a sitting president.

(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

ANDREW MCCABE, FORMER DEPUTY FBI DIRECTOR: Discussion of the 25th Amendment was simply Rod raised the issue and discussed it with me in the context of thinking about how many other cabinet officials might support such an effort. What I can say is the Deputy Attorney General was definitely very concerned about the President, about his capacity, and about his intent at that point in time.

(END VIDEO CLIP)

DOBBS: Ladies and gentlemen, that is a confession. Where is the outrage about their treason? Where is the Republican Party and its leaders demanding they arrest McCabe and the rest of his cohorts who conspired to overthrow the President of the United States? McCabe's admission of the coup attempted by the corrupt deep state went without as much a follow-up question by CBS. Where is the national media? Left-wing, though it may be, it in demanding answers, accountability, and transparency for this aversion and outright sedition?

Judicial watch President, Tom Fitton, Radio Show Host, Tammy Bruce among our guest here tonight to discuss those questions and their answers. Former Vice President Joe Biden, over the weekend calling the United States embarrassing. As globalist foreign leaders and the radical Dems applaud their approval of his careless and outrageous remarks on foreign soil.

(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

JOE BIDEN, FORMER VICE PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES: The America I see values basic human decency. Not snatching children from their parents or turning their back on refugees on our border. Americans know that's not right. The American people understand, please, because it makes us embarrassing.

(END VIDEO CLIP)

DOBBS: Well, Biden is the embarrassment. What should be embarrassing to Biden is that he can't even garner the support of his former president, President Barack Obama. Obama saying he will not endorse a Democrat for president even if Biden decides to run. We take up Biden's embarrassing trip overseas. Republican Strategist, Ed Rollins, Matt Schlapp joins us. And President Trump today in Miami issuing his strong support for Venezuelan opposition leader, Juan Guido.

The President's message clear and definitive. The United States will never be a socialist nation, we take up the President's address and much more here tonight. Our top story, former acting director of the FBI, Andrew McCabe confessed there was in fact a deep state conspiracy among his cohorts in the Justice Department and FBI to remove President Trump from office. Fox Chief Intelligence Correspondent, Catherine Herridge with the story.

(BEGIN VIDEOTAPE)

MCCABE: Counting votes, or possible vote.

CATHERINE HERRIDGE, FOX NEWS CHIEF INTELLIGENCE CORRESPONDENT: The former acting FBI director told "60 MINUTES" the Deputy Attorney General Rod Rosenstein openly discussed how many cabinet members would support invoking the 25th Amendment to remove the President. But the FBI's former general counsel, James Baker who met contemporaneously with McCabe and FBI lawyer Lisa Page about their conversations with Rosenstein testified the effort went further.

"I had the impression the Deputy Attorney General had already discussed this with two members in the President's cabinet. And that they were on board with this concept already." On Twitter the President responded to McCabe on "60 MINUTES," "While, so many lies by now disgraced acting FBI Director Andrew McCabe. He and Rod Rosenstein look like they were planning a very illegal act."

McCabe and others say the President's May 2017 firing of Director James Comey left the FBI and Justice Department in turmoil. And they concerned that the firing was designed to be synced the Russian probe and obstruct justice.

MCCABE: The Deputy Attorney General offered to wear a wire into the White House. He said, I never get search when I going to the White House. I think the General Counsel had a heart attack. When he got up off the floor he said, I -- that's a bridge too far.

HERRIDGE: But Baker who could face criminal penalties for lying to Congressional investigators testified "My recollection is that there were discussions about it over longer period than the course of one meeting, a couple of days."

(END VIDEOTAPE)

HERRIDGE: McCabe said Rosenstein initially resisted a Special Counsel because the Deputy Attorney General worried he might lose his job. A senior department official told Fox tonight the Special Counsel was appointed "to ensure that the Russia investigation was truly independent and without bias." Something the official said that McCabe could not have accomplished. Lou?

DOBBS: Catherine, thanks very much. Catherine Herridge. Well, joining us tonight, Tom Fitton, he's the President of Judicial Watch. One of the country's most effective watchdog groups. And he's worked with the International Policy Forum, the Leadership Institute, Accuracy in Media, among others. Tom, good to have you with us. What we just heard from the folks at "60 MINUTES" over at CBS, although they didn't ask a follow-up question, it was an outright confession by McCabe that he was committing felonies and an attempt to overthrow the President of the United States along with a number of his colleagues. Your reaction when you heard it?

TOM FITTON, PRESIDENT, JUDICIAL WATCH: Well, it's extraordinary. It confirms early reports last year that this discussion took place. You know, Lou, if there were generals and colonels in the Pentagon talking like this, there would be no doubt we'll be -- we'll be calling it a coup. But because you got -- I don't like the bureaucrats and appointed officials talking like this and it's -- the target is President Trump, they don't care.

And America should realize this is how you can lose a Republic where you have appointees of the President and bureaucrats to answer to virtually no one talk about manipulating the law in order to overturn a presidential election and attack a president they don't like. They don't like for any substantial reason. They don't like him because they fired -- he fired his buddy, McCabe's buddy and Rosenstein's buddy, James Comey.

(CROSSTALK)

DOBBS: At the recommendation of Rod Rosenstein, by the way.

(CROSSTALK)

FITTON: Right. A fight about a personnel decision. And they're going to overthrow the presidency. And, you know, let's be clear here, Mueller is a successor to this coup attempt. He's -- the appointment flows out of all of these discussions and we should recognize that the effort to overthrow the President is continuing with Justice Department help through this out-of-control Mueller investigation.

DOBBS: And without so much as -- and effort, explanation, rationalization, this is -- we're watching McCabe basically saying he was doing it for the country's own good. Here's a man sworn to enforce the law, to enforce the constitution of the United States, to defend the United States committing subversions, in my opinion, sedition and treason. And those who want to say that we're not at war should reference the war on terror that we've been engaged in for 19 -- almost 19 years.

This is outrageous and we haven't heard a word from the leadership of the Republican Party about arresting these people. We haven't heard a word from the so-called establishment that is supposed to hold the tenants values of this -- of this great nation and primacy. They are just simply averting their eyes. It's appalling, it's disgusting, there should be outrage throughout the country in both parties across every part of this nation.

DOBBS: Well, I agree. And the problem with the Justice Department is that Mueller is still running the Justice Department effectively. And so any effort to uncover what went on behind this investigation and this is what went on behind this investigation, runs into the Mueller juggernaut. And, you know, Attorney General Barr, he needs to step up and defend the President. You know, the argument for -- against Barr was will he stand up to President Trump?

And I think the test for Attorney General Barr is, will he stand up for President Trump and for the rule of law against these deep stators and the establishment who don't care about our constitution. You know, President Trump may survive this attack on him but maybe another President want. And we'll lose our Republic and we won't even know it came.

DOBBS: Well, I guarantee he will survive these attacks. He's already demonstrated that he is stronger than the entire lot of these extraordinary venal, vicious actors in the Justice Department. What may not survive is his Justice Department and the FBI. And Tom Fitton, should they survive? Because they are the root of the corruption and the malignancy of the others wanted to subscribe to this administration.

When, in point of fact, they have been the perpetrators of wrongdoing from the months preceding the presidency of Donald Trump.

FITTON: Well, my -- you know, I'm a small government conservative. I think all government agencies should be subject to scrutiny every year before any money is given to them. And given the corruption at the DOJ, I think we should be --

(CROSSTALK)

DOBBS: The problem with that is, the appropriators as well as the investigators are also deep state actors and have been working just as viciously, frankly, behind the scenes as the people in the Justice Department and the FBI. My god.

FITTON: You know, the problem with the FBI is the current leadership frankly, Mr. Ray has zero interest in reforming the organization.

DOBBS: Where is he?

FITTON: That's why --

DOBBS: I mean, we don't even hear from him.

FITTON: He is missing in action when it comes to standing and uncovering -- I -- uncovering the corruption and to a degree he said anything, Lou, he's been excusing the corruption.

DOBBS: Yes. Exactly. Tom, it's always good to have you here. I wish we're talking in better circumstances. But, as you intimated at the outset, the Republic itself is at stake here.

FITTON: That's right.

DOBBS: And the silence is absolutely chilling. Thank you so much, Tom Fitton.

FITTON: Welcome.

DOBBS: And again, as always, and I mean it even when I don't say, thanks for everything that you and Judicial Watch do. Thanks so much.

FITTON: You're welcome. Thank you.

DOBBS: Up next, one of the most embarrassing figures in modern American political history. Former Vice President Joe Biden has taken his anti- American message overseas embarrassing the United States in front of our allies and many of his former colleagues in the Obama administration. It's a shadow government. We'll take that up and more right after this quick break. Ed Rollins joins me. Stay with us.

(COMMERCIAL BREAK)

DOBBS: A New York Times report today saying former President Obama is counseling the Dems' 2020 hopefuls but he will not be giving the New York Times assures us, anyone, anyone, not even Joe Biden, his endorsement. His former Vice President taking a page out of his old Obama playbook. Apologizing for America overseas.

(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

BIDEN: The America I see values basic human decency. Not snatching children from their parents. It makes us an embarrassing in the example we're setting. Well, I should stop. As my mother would say, this too shall pass. We will be back.

(END VIDEO CLIP)

DOBBS: I wouldn't bet on it. In any way, shape, or fashion, at least not led by one Joe Biden. He's just blown his chances for 2020 in all likelihood. Biden, it seems forgot one important lesson from his former boss. President Obama at least waited until he had been elected and was in office before slamming America overseas. Well, joining us tonight, former Reagan White House political director, Fox Business Political Analyst Ed Rollins. Ed, great to have you with us.

ED ROLLINS, FOX BUSINESS NETWORK CONTRIBUTOR: Thank you.

DOBBS: What a day. Let's start with Biden, he just blew it, didn't he?

ROLLINS: Well, he certainly did something outrageous than anybody I've ever known. A former Vice President to go before this important meeting and condemn the America is just outrageous. You often do that if you're a presidential candidate in Iowa, or (INAUDIBLE) New Hampshire or somewhere. But to go before our allies and to basically take apart the administration's position is just outrageous.

DOBBS: When President Obama did that, his famous apology tour in Berlin in Cairo, he had been elected.

ROLLINS: He'd been elected.

(CROSSTALK)

DOBBS: You know, there was a chance to make things right in 2012. Romney didn't make that happen. I think Biden can just kiss it goodbye, personally. I would like to turn to this extraordinary piece on "60 MINUTES" in which Andrew McCabe actually confessed to trying to overthrow the President of the United States, Ed. And where's the outrage from the Republican leadership? I mean, I think the whole country should be just --

(CROSSTALK)

ROLLINS: I have to tell you, from when I sat and watched it last night I was outraged because there's a conspiracy going on. First of all, the 25th Amendment is for a president to step aside if he has health issues or something else.

DOBBS: Right.

ROLLINS: Or a Vice President to step in if the President is incapacitated. It is not about removing a president from office. And I think to a certain extent, you think the Justice Department --

(CROSSTALK)

DOBBS: These guys were not only obviously corrupt, they were stupid beyond imagining for people who were supposedly trained in law and respectful of it.

ROLLINS: And the fact that before this, any evidence that basically still plotting and scheming to take out a President of the United States and talking to members of the cabinet according to him with the full support of the acting attorney general, I just found it appalling. It's so un-American, it's like --

DOBBS: So, where is the Republican Party? Why aren't the leaders of the Republican Party on Capitol Hill, every republican governor, every Republican governor, every Republican in this country standing up and saying end the witch-hunt, end all of this non-sense, it's obviously a cabal that has been working and the conspiracy to overthrow the President of the United States or tacitly they are endorsing it with their silence.

ROLLINS: Well, their silence is terrible. The reality is we are in a fight of our life. President Trump basically doing everything he promised to do, moving the ball forward. But the Democrats are really revved up and they're going to do everything they can to stop him. From lawsuits to what have you. And they're not going to --

(CROSSTALK)

DOBBS: -- in the land that will join this president on the basis of his declaration of a national emergency. I -- we know then that the corruption has absolutely grasped our judiciary system as well. We got every indication that that's happened. But for them to enjoin a president in a matter of national security would be an act against the Republic, the constitution itself.

ROLLINS: Well, you and I have been around long enough to know that's going to happen. And at the end of the day it's going to end up being in the Supreme Court. And the Supreme Court has to rule in the President's favor at the end of the day here. But it's going to go through the process. There's -- all of these political attorney generals and what have you who want to make (INAUDIBLE)

DOBBS: But honorable, honest and judges who are not overwhelmed by their partisan prejudice would understand that that it could be absolutely litigated in our judiciary. Without enjoining until a decision by the high court. That would be the honorable thing to do.

ROLLINS: That's the absolute honoring thing to do. And I would -- I would hope the Supreme Court is stepping very quickly if they started out this process.

DOBBS: Yes. I worry about this court and what more -- the more that we learned about Chief Justice John Roberts, I'm not saying when about, what will or will not occur in that high court.

ROLLINS: I'm hopeful in the end he will do the right thing.

DOBBS: Yes. Well, we can all hope. But I'd rather have certainty.

ROLLINS: In the end. In the end. There is no certainty -- there's no certainty in life.

DOBBS: Well, there isn't. But in this constitution there should be absolute certainty. Ed Rollins, thanks much.

ROLLINS: Thank you.

DOBBS: We appreciate it. We'd like to hear your thoughts on all this. Share your comments, follow me on Twitter @LouDobbs, like me on Facebook, follow me on Instagram @LouDobbsTonight. Coming up here next, Chicago Police, they want answers from actor, Jussie Smollett after their investigation into an alleged hate crime reverses. That and much more coming up next. We'll be talking with Washington Times' Tammy Bruce.

Before we go to break, let's take a look at the U.S. national debt as if we don't have enough problems already. $22 trillion and climbing. We're coming right back after this. Stay brave of heart, we'll be right back.

(COMMERCIAL BREAK)

DOBBS: President Trump in Miami today for claiming the days of socialism in the western hemisphere are numbered.

(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

TRUMP: If you choose this path, you have the opportunity to help forge a safe and prosperous future for all of the people of Venezuela. Or you can choose the second path, continuing to support Maduro. If you choose this path, you will find no safe harbor, no easy exit, and no way out. You will lose everything.

(END VIDEO CLIP)

DOBBS: President Trump also using his speech to continue to express his supportive of Venezuelan opposition leader, Juan Guido. A reported hate crime in Chicago looking more and more like a hate hoax. Chicago Police say they no longer consider actor Jussie Smollett a victim. And they are pushing for a follow-up interview which his attorney -- Smollett's attorneys have resisted. The police request -- imagine that, a request comes amid new reports that Smollett paid two Nigerian brothers to carry out the assault.

Both men have been questioned and released without charges. Reverend Al Sharpton, we want to point out, responding to the news. And Sharpton saying Smollett should face as he put it, "accountability to the maximum" if it's found the actor stage the attack. Joining us tonight, Tammy Bruce, Washington Times Columnist, Fox Business Contributor. Tammy, good to see you.

TAMMY BRUCE, FOX BUSINESS NETWORK CONTRIBUTOR: Hi, everybody.

DOBBS: Let's start with Smollett and the hoax. I have to give Reverend Al Sharpton great credit for standing up which by the way all of the candidates who have been commenting on this, the Democratic candidates have not had the courage to do. Your thoughts.

BRUCE: Yes. The candidates seem to be wanting to pretend this never happened. They get away without law because then the media also steps away from it and stops discussing it. But Reverend Al Sharpton of course is very well known for promoting one of the original hoaxes, if you will with a young woman named Tawana Brawley who made some accusations against police officers which ended up being false.

So it's fascinating that he would actually take that position. So good for him if he has found, you know, the right direction. And maybe -- I don't know, maybe he's thinking that Mr. Smollett deserves a program on MSNBC like he has. Who knows what that end result should be.

DOBBS: Well, you brought that to us with a sense of appropriate justice.

BRUCE: Absolutely. Hanging every day, every day.

DOBBS: Let's turn to Venezuela, the President today importantly going to Miami as the setting to announce his views and judgment and policies on the hemisphere and Venezuela in particular. Your thoughts?

BRUCE: Yes. Perfect of course. We know for South Florida it has a lot of people who are immigrants who have experienced in our lifetimes very recently, the impact of totalitarianism and tyrants. So when he --

DOBBS: And Venezuelans by the way.

BRUCE: Well, Venezuelans and Cubans. So when he's speaking it happens to be the right thing, of course it is the thing that the President believes in. But it also speaks to the Venezuelans that are already in South Florida that are coming to South Florida but speaking to that core of people in this region that understand the importance of freedom, this nation, capitalism and the value of the support of the American Presidents.

And so it's going to make I think a big different for people there and sends a very strong message back home about what his intentions are.

DOBBS: I think he had a couple of other audiences as well in mind as he spoke. And one of this of course the American people when he said this country will never be socialist. That was a loud straightforward challenge to everyone of the -- what seemed to be every one of the Democratic hopefuls so far. At least announced, this is not going to be an easy campaign for you because you've already gone to the left and lined up against this country and our traditions.

BRUCE: Yes. It's the first education they may be receiving about real life. These are -- especially young people, Miss Ocasio-Cortez obviously seems to not have any major education about the impact of socialism.

DOBBS: Or minor.

BRUCE: Or a minor education on the nape on how it destroys lives, on how it destroys countries and economies. So, this is going to be her first indication about courtesy of the President, about real life and what socialism does to people.

DOBBS: This could be an expensive tutorial for AOC if it moves into, as it appears, it is about to, into the 2020 presidential election.

BRUCE: Yes. This is -- it could be. And she won't understand this, I think, until 2020. The benefit of this education for the American people about what the Democratic Party is becoming, and how everybody is running on this kind of an issue.

The President stands as the bulwark against this framework and as a reminder about what -- how greatness really can be brought into our lives. And it's not through certainly that totalitarianism by any stretch.

DOBBS: And most to me, it's very encouraging to see the presidential tracking poll with the president's popularity. I had approval rising at 52 percent. I confess that I personally think it should be significantly higher, and I hope it soon will be.

BRUCE: It probably is, as a matter of fact. When you think about the --

DOBBS: I'd like to see it expressed in black-and-white.

BRUCE: Yes, yes.

DOBBS: Like you, I have faith in the forgotten man and woman in this country. But this president, I think now, has turned a very important corner. I think the national left-wing media understands it. It is beginning to understand it. That's why they are not quite as free with their nonsense as they have been.

In other words, Jim Acosta is receding quite a bit, as his colleagues, I think, on the left, in that White House briefing room, for example, it's one of the barometers of this all.

BRUCE: That's good news.

DOBBS: Tammy, good to have you here.

BRUCE: Yes, thank you, sir.

DOBBS: Tammy Bruce, thanks. Up next, British lawmakers say Facebook is acting like gangsters with our personal information. We take that up. Now, the Europeans are doing something about it. Why in the world isn't the United States? Isn't privacy an even bigger right for Americans? We take that up with cyber expert, Morgan Wright. Stay with us, we'll be right back. Oh, Google, Facebook, gangsters.

(COMMERCIAL BREAK)

DOBBS: Headlines tonight, Acting Defense Secretary, Patrick Shanahan, claims he has "a lot of discretion on border wall funding from President Trump's national emergency declaration," despite receiving a direct order from the President of the United States to secure the border.

Shanahan says "I'm not required to do anything." Well, he'd be required to do something, one would think, like pack his bags and get out of there. A North Carolina elections board, beginning deliberations over election fraud allegations, Republican Mark Harris leading in last month's ninth congressional district election.

The board consists of three Democrats, two Republicans, they will decide whether to certify a winner or order a new election, Harris, by the way, leading Democrat Dan McCready, by 905 votes, but again, the vote that may count as the 3-2 vote on the elections board.

A new report from the U.K. parliament, calling Facebook, digital gangsters, for failing to thwart attempts by Russia to influence elections, the report accusing CEO Mark Zuckerberg of contempt of parliament.

Joining me now, Morgan Wright, Former Senior Advisor in the State Department's Antiterrorism Assistance Program, Former Law Enforcement Advisor to the Republican National Committee, Cyber Security Expert, Morgan, great to see you.

MORGAN WRIGHT, EXPERT, CYBERSECURITY: Hey, Lou.

DOBBS: Let me start with, first, the gangsters that Facebook and Google. Who knew that they were going to be declared gangsters first by the U.K., rather than the United States?

WRIGHT: Yes, I don't see Al Pacino playing Mark Zuckerberg in a movie, you know, about gangsters, but yes, you know. And Lou, we've talked about this before about why is the -- why is the E.U. ahead of us with things like the General Data Protection Regulations, privacy?

And I'll tell you, the only thing I can think of as it comes down to money, because there's a -- Facebook has figured out the Google playbook, which is, spend a lot of money, spend a lot of time here in D.C., on K Street, M Street, whatever all the streets are, and you know, get in there and lobby people, spread lots of money around.

And Lou, during the hearings, how many members of Congress did we see ponder to Mark Zuckerberg, hoping to relocate shit jobs in their district. I mean, this is one reason why you don't have it because everybody's hoping to get something from Zuckerberg.

DOBBS: Yes, and -- but it reinforces the impression.

WRIGHT: Right.

DOBBS: That a half dozen of big tech companies, including Facebook and Google, have such concentrated economic and technological and political power, that they are almost now so large that it is impossible to rein them in. Is that fear well-placed?

WRIGHT: Yes. I mean, absolutely. And I'll tell you, Lou, you and I talked about this awhile back too, when we talked about how globalism is killing patriotism. And all of these companies have taken the advantage of the U.S. (INAUDIBLE) well guess what?

It's coming home to roost now, because now that these companies want to be global. Your subject to the E.U. regulations, the U.K. regulations, you know, Germany's regulations, all of these other places that actually place a premium on privacy, for too long self-regulation, they've tried it, it hasn't worked.

So, I think what you're going to see is the self-regulation go away. And you're going to see more government interventions starting overseas, and hopefully, it'll end up over here, not to put them out of business, but, man, we've got to put a check on the seemingly unchecked power that they have right now.

DOBBS: There is no countervailing influence in our economy, or our society, or our body politic to the awesome power of big tech. That's simply a fact, and to that, the power of Wall Street and Corporate America.

And right now, the middle class in this country, if they were not the champion, the President of the United States would be defenseless against an onslaught that had rolled back the middle class for 20 years, and which under this president, is once again, growing.

WRIGHT: Right. And look, you know, something interesting that came out of the U.K. report too, is they talked about -- even though Zuckerberg, in front of Congress, and sent his minions over there to say we don' sell any data, it's clear they've been selling data. It's true that they've been using apps to spy on the activities of users and their competitors.

Look, this is the modern version.

DOBBS: And even those who are not users.

WRIGHT: --have that power, right, absolutely. And the KGB only wished they would've had this power back in the day. You know, our NSA and FBI don't have near the power that Facebook, Google, Amazon. You know, these folks have to spy into the lives of us, but there are no consequences for it. At some point, there has to be stick because the carrot hasn't worked.

DOBBS: Yes. This is a president who is keenly aware --

WRIGHT: Right.

DOBBS: -- that U.S. policies haven't worked. He is also confronted now by ZTE, as a favor to President Xi. He backed off of the consequences for ZTE, Huawei, now paying the consequences for its role in spying, but doing so, only within our court system, not as a result of a national security response from the part of the United States.

How much longer can we go without saying straightforwardly to the Chinese, there will be a response on national security terms if you continue to steal hundreds of billions of dollars from this country each year and carry out acts of espionage nonstop.

WRIGHT: Look, I think Gordon Chang's been on with before he talked about poor Chinese economically, I think they need to put -- they need to put the hammer down on Huawei. It's time to put Huawei and ZTE out of business.

And I'll tell you why, Lou, the upcoming 5G, Huawei is doing everything they can to get their technology into these countries, but you've Australia, New Zealand, Japan. The U.K. said it's going to take, you know -- they probably going to have to spend five years and $2-$3 billion to meet the U.K. standards.

The best way to stop this economic espionage is to quit lulling the government of China to subsidize the rail system, the electronic system, the communication systems to where it's all Chinese infrastructure. And there's no U.S. infrastructure in play. We can't -- it's not a fair fight.

So, I think they've got to put the hammer down on these guys. One of the ways to stop espionage is to keep their equipment out of our infrastructure.

DOBBS: And the -- and the administration to its credit is trying to do exactly that. Huawei, at the same time, is bragging they are now too big to stop. And this is -- this again, is advised rhetoric from the PLA and from President Xi, himself.

The Communist Party is now flaunting their economic and political and military power. The United States is -- has to simply respond, and hopefully, before it becomes a military response.

WRIGHT: Right.

DOBBS: But it looks as though we are absolutely vulnerable in cyberspace right now. Is that a correct impression?

WRIGHT: Yes, absolutely. Lou, we have -- from our power grid, to our nuclear plants, to you know -- the rail system transportation. A lot of things are still so vulnerable because we're so fragmented. We don't have --

Even though we might have an overall plan, we don't have an overall coherent ability to secure all the things we need to do, why, because the private sector owns 85 percent of the critical infrastructure that's out there.

The government can provide a lot of support, a lot of help, but were the Iranians, the Russians, the Chinese? And even the North Koreans are exploiting. They're exploiting all of these gaps between the different infrastructures.

DOBBS: Right.

WRIGHT: The lack of coherence among the security plans. And the old technology that's out there. We've got out-of-date machines that are still running windows that haven't been supported for five or six years.

DOBBS: What Morgan is not saying, that 85 percent that is in the private sector, is often run by CEOs and boards that are frankly, friendlier to Chinese policies than they are to the policies of the Trump administration and the U.S. government. And that's got to change, straightaway. I didn't put words in your mouth, did I, Morgan?

WRIGHT: Lou, you're always right. That's one lesson I've learned.

DOBBS: Morgan, thanks so much. I appreciate it.

WRIGHT: You bet, Lou.

DOBBS: Good to see you, Morgan Wright.

Up next, New York Governor Bill -- New York Mayor, Bill de Blasio says AOC doesn't know what she is talking about. We take that up after the break with American Conservative Union Chairman Matt Schlapp. Stay with us, we'll be right back.

(COMMERCIAL BREAK)

DOBBS: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio putting freshman Democratic Congresswoman Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez in her place after Amazon decided not to build its headquarters in Long Island City. Cortez claimed the failed deal would free up $4 billion in taxes incentives for the city to use elsewhere. The good mayor reminded her even a socialist understood this, at least one of the socialists did, reminding her the money would only be available after the city secured the Amazon jobs and revenue and that it wasn't in a budget somewhere.

Radical freshman congresswoman, there's a lot of those going around. Ilhan Omar scheduled to raise money in March for the Hamas link council on American-Islamic relations. Omar received $5,000 from them during a run for Congress. She since repeatedly made headlines for her anti-Semitic remarks most recently suggesting Republican support of Israel is bought and paid for by the American Israel Public Affairs Committee, AIPAC. At some point anti-Semitic remarks result in being anti -- an anti-Semite it seems.

Joining us tonight is Matt Schlapp. He's the chairman of the American Conservative Union. Why is it that the Left is suddenly so reluctant to say what is obvious that they have an anti-Semitic strain within their party and on Capitol Hill and aren't dealing with it?

MATT SCHLAPP, CHAIRMAN, AMERICAN CONSERVATIVE UNION: Well, I completely agree with you, Lou, but I asked -- I actually think it's more cynical than this. I think the Democratic Party has really shed its longtime support of the State of Israel. I think they're moving away from this policy point of view and I think it gives Donald Trump who has done everything he said he would do with getting rid of the Iran deal, moving the embassy a great chance with these voters not with the not with the Liberal leaders potentially of this community but with everyday voters who can see anti-Semitism when it's so clear.

DOBBS: Anti-Semitism, we saw reports today that the yellow vest in France you know, blaming them for a strain of anti-Semitism within France leaving out the entire ruling body and class in France that -- I mean there's anti-Semitism has been a huge issue in France. It is not only anti-Israel, it is pro-Palestinian, and the expression is found throughout the political structure of France. This looks like another gambit to lay off blame for what is a strengthening strain of anti-Semitism in France and indeed Europe.

SCHLAPP: That's right. And look, I think what's happening -- what's ironic, Lou, is what's happening in Israel is this once socialist country has really been embracing free markets and innovation and really has become a kindred soul in one of our closest allies to obviously to America and to our way of life into our values.

And I think there's a lot of people that just hate everything about the idea of innovation of entrepreneurs or free markets of the little guy being able to go to market and take his ideas to the customers. And they are against every aspect of that and I love the fact that Israel in America and freedom-loving people including the people of South America, including the freedom lovers in Venezuela. We're working together to rid the world of this dreaded socialism.

DOBBS: Dreaded socialism is not the same thing as anti-Semitism and that really what I was asking you about. Socialism is as the President assured is this country will never be socialistic. What is in question tonight is whether or not one guy you know, is going to be the successor to Maduro. Will he or will he not and what is your sense from where you look?

SCHLAPP: It's a great question, Lou. And I worry I think it's a little bit of a jump ball right now. I think the President, John Bolton, and Mike Pompeo we're trying to do everything they can to use power in influence to stand up for the Venezuelan people in this new president Mr. Guaido. And Maduro is a -- is a tin-pot dictator. And you know they have a lot of power at the end of their reigns. And we'll see if he's able to use that power. But I'm hopeful that the right side will win out in Venezuela.

DOBBS: Well, there's a lot of hope running around this country right now primarily because President Trump is indeed the leader of the free world. My question to you is why is the establishment in Washington D.C. not screaming for the arrest of Andrew McCabe and for all of his cohorts and the DOJ and the FBI? Why is it that there seems to be almost a satisfaction in the status quo no matter how rancid and corrupt in the swamp that is D.C.

SCHLAPP: Look, I'm disgusted by it and I guess there's only one person who can do something about it and that's Bill Barr. Is he either going to do this or he's not, and I'd be greatly disappointed if he doesn't. And I think --

DOBBS: Well, why the hell isn't the Republican Party's standing up and demanding his arrest? Why --

SCHLAPP: You know why.

DOBBS: I do not know why. I would not be asking you.

SCHLAPP: Well, I think the reason is because they don't want the controversy of actually taking the deep state on because they might be coming its next victim.

DOBBS: Then their doubtless wonders and why in the world should we tolerate these Koch brothers hired excuses for legislators and representatives. They represent nothing but Koch brothers, the Wall Street, the Business Roundtable, the Chamber, they are -- it's enough to make you sick.

SCHLAPP: Lou, if that's where the Republican Party stays, it will deserve to lose beyond the ash heap of history. We either going to represent the people or we're not and if we don't, we deserve to lose and we ought to get out of the way.

DOBBS: It's very simple. They either follow President Trump or they are going to be on the scrap heap of history. The problem is they could take the Republican with them. Matt, good to have you with us.

SCHLAPP: Thanks, Lou.

DOBBS: Good to see you.

SCHLAPP: Good to see you too.

DOBBS: Up next, more on the dark political agenda of the deep state, their efforts to subvert the presidency of Donald Trump -- that's right -- to overthrow the U.S. government. Stay with us. We'll be right back with that and more.

(COMMERCIAL BREAK)

DOBBS: Andrew McCabe, fired as acting director of the FBI last night on 60 Minutes confessed he was involved in an effort to remove well, President Trump from office and to overthrow the government of the United States. Judicial Watch's Tom Fitton says McCabe, the Department of Justice and the FBI were trying to overthrow the government and this republic.

TOM FITTON, PRESIDENT JUDICIAL WATCH: If there were generals and colonels in the Pentagon talking like this, there would be no doubt the media would be calling it a coup. But because you've got an elected bureaucrats and appointed officials talking like this, and if the target is President Trump, they don't care. And Americans should realize this is how you can lose a republic.

(END VIDEO CLIP)

DOBBS: That's it for us tonight. We thank you for being with us. Tomorrow night, Congressman Mark Green, David Bossie, and Attorney Harmeet Dhillon among our guests tomorrow. We hope you'll join us. Thanks for being with us tonight. Follow me on Twitter @LouDobbs. And again, thanks for being with us. Good night.

END

urn:contentItem:5VG5-1901-JBHT-D063-00000-00Andrew McCabe Claims Trump Believed Putin Over U.S. Intelligence; Jussie Smollett Staged Attack After Racist Letter Didn't Get Bigger Reaction; Trump Urges Venezuelan Military Officials To Back Juan Guaido; Trump: America Will Never Be A Socialist Country; U.K. Parliament Issues Report Calling Facebook 'Digital Gangsters'; De Blasio and Ocasio-Cortez Feud Over Failed Amazon Deal; Rep. Omar To Fundraise For Hamas-Linked Muslim Organization; Combating Anti-Semitism2019-02-19T00:00:00Z2020-10-05T21:11:39ZLexisNexisAndrew McCabe Claims Trump Believed Putin Over U.S. Intelligence; Jussie Smollett Staged Attack After Racist Letter Didn't Get Bigger Reaction; Trump Urges Venezuelan Military Officials To Back Juan Guaido; Trump: America Will Never Be A Socialist Country; U.K. Parliament Issues Report Calling Facebook 'Digital Gangsters'; De Blasio and Ocasio-Cortez Feud Over Failed Amazon Deal; Rep. Omar To Fundraise For Hamas-Linked Muslim Organization; Combating Anti-SemitismLanhamFULL TEXT

LOU DOBBS, FOX BUSINESS NETWORK ANCHOR: Good evening, everybody. This aversion is President Trump and his administration on full display this weekend as former FBI Acting Director Andrew McCabe actually confessed that he, Deputy Attorney General Rod Rosenstein and a host of corrupt FBI and Department of Justice actors sought to unseat a sitting president.

(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

ANDREW MCCABE, FORMER DEPUTY FBI DIRECTOR: Discussion of the 25th Amendment was simply Rod raised the issue and discussed it with me in the context of thinking about how many other cabinet officials might support such an effort. What I can say is the Deputy Attorney General was definitely very concerned about the President, about his capacity, and about his intent at that point in time.

(END VIDEO CLIP)

DOBBS: Ladies and gentlemen, that is a confession. Where is the outrage about their treason? Where is the Republican Party and its leaders demanding they arrest McCabe and the rest of his cohorts who conspired to overthrow the President of the United States? McCabe's admission of the coup attempted by the corrupt deep state went without as much a follow-up question by CBS. Where is the national media? Left-wing, though it may be, it in demanding answers, accountability, and transparency for this aversion and outright sedition?

Judicial watch President, Tom Fitton, Radio Show Host, Tammy Bruce among our guest here tonight to discuss those questions and their answers. Former Vice President Joe Biden, over the weekend calling the United States embarrassing. As globalist foreign leaders and the radical Dems applaud their approval of his careless and outrageous remarks on foreign soil.

(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

JOE BIDEN, FORMER VICE PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES: The America I see values basic human decency. Not snatching children from their parents or turning their back on refugees on our border. Americans know that's not right. The American people understand, please, because it makes us embarrassing.

(END VIDEO CLIP)

DOBBS: Well, Biden is the embarrassment. What should be embarrassing to Biden is that he can't even garner the support of his former president, President Barack Obama. Obama saying he will not endorse a Democrat for president even if Biden decides to run. We take up Biden's embarrassing trip overseas. Republican Strategist, Ed Rollins, Matt Schlapp joins us. And President Trump today in Miami issuing his strong support for Venezuelan opposition leader, Juan Guido.

The President's message clear and definitive. The United States will never be a socialist nation, we take up the President's address and much more here tonight. Our top story, former acting director of the FBI, Andrew McCabe confessed there was in fact a deep state conspiracy among his cohorts in the Justice Department and FBI to remove President Trump from office. Fox Chief Intelligence Correspondent, Catherine Herridge with the story.

(BEGIN VIDEOTAPE)

MCCABE: Counting votes, or possible vote.

CATHERINE HERRIDGE, FOX NEWS CHIEF INTELLIGENCE CORRESPONDENT: The former acting FBI director told "60 MINUTES" the Deputy Attorney General Rod Rosenstein openly discussed how many cabinet members would support invoking the 25th Amendment to remove the President. But the FBI's former general counsel, James Baker who met contemporaneously with McCabe and FBI lawyer Lisa Page about their conversations with Rosenstein testified the effort went further.

"I had the impression the Deputy Attorney General had already discussed this with two members in the President's cabinet. And that they were on board with this concept already." On Twitter the President responded to McCabe on "60 MINUTES," "While, so many lies by now disgraced acting FBI Director Andrew McCabe. He and Rod Rosenstein look like they were planning a very illegal act."

McCabe and others say the President's May 2017 firing of Director James Comey left the FBI and Justice Department in turmoil. And they concerned that the firing was designed to be synced the Russian probe and obstruct justice.

MCCABE: The Deputy Attorney General offered to wear a wire into the White House. He said, I never get search when I going to the White House. I think the General Counsel had a heart attack. When he got up off the floor he said, I -- that's a bridge too far.

HERRIDGE: But Baker who could face criminal penalties for lying to Congressional investigators testified "My recollection is that there were discussions about it over longer period than the course of one meeting, a couple of days."

(END VIDEOTAPE)

HERRIDGE: McCabe said Rosenstein initially resisted a Special Counsel because the Deputy Attorney General worried he might lose his job. A senior department official told Fox tonight the Special Counsel was appointed "to ensure that the Russia investigation was truly independent and without bias." Something the official said that McCabe could not have accomplished. Lou?

DOBBS: Catherine, thanks very much. Catherine Herridge. Well, joining us tonight, Tom Fitton, he's the President of Judicial Watch. One of the country's most effective watchdog groups. And he's worked with the International Policy Forum, the Leadership Institute, Accuracy in Media, among others. Tom, good to have you with us. (COMMERCIAL BREAK)

DOBBS: Andrew McCabe, fired as acting director of the FBI last night on 60 Minutes confessed he was involved in an effort to remove well, President Trump from office and to overthrow the government of the United States. Judicial Watch's Tom Fitton says McCabe, the Department of Justice and the FBI were trying to overthrow the government and this republic.

TOM FITTON, PRESIDENT JUDICIAL WATCH: If there were generals and colonels in the Pentagon talking like this, there would be no doubt the media would be calling it a coup. But because you've got an elected bureaucrats and appointed officials talking like this, and if the target is President Trump, they don't care. And Americans should realize this is how you can lose a republic.

(END VIDEO CLIP)

DOBBS: That's it for us tonight. We thank you for being with us. Tomorrow night, Congressman Mark Green, David Bossie, and Attorney Harmeet Dhillon among our guests tomorrow. We hope you'll join us. Thanks for being with us tonight. Follow me on Twitter @LouDobbs. And again, thanks for being with us. Good night.

END
